msgSnippet: EasyMock and JMock can be used to mock any interface (and classes). You can try to use it to mock jdbc object, but it might be heavy if your design is not
messageBody:
EasyMock and JMock can be used to mock any interface (and classes).
You can try to use it to mock jdbc object, but it might be heavy if
your design is not prepared for it (You might have to write an
important number of mock expectations).

Alternatively, you could also have a look to DBUnit. But for that,
you need a DB.

I know it is not the answer that you expected, but I hope it will help
you.

Gilles

> Hi,
>
> I apologise for the repeat post, but thought I might get some answers

> JUnit in Action uses DynaMock for its database testing examples in
